body.name: JUNO & Co. Bubble Toner for Face Rehydrating and Balancing Facial Toner 85ml/2.87 Fl Oz
features: Its refreshing, foamy texture deeply rehydrates the skin for a water-oil balance

PRICKLY PEAR EXTRACT: A Cactus-Derived Skin Protecting and Hydrating Ingredient. This sustainable ingredient aids in soothing and calming irritated skin due to the piscidic acid. Help protect and firm the skin, leading to smoother and well-hydrated skin.
HYALURONIC ACID: Works to attract and hold onto moisture in the skin as well as support the skin barrier, leaving the skin softer and less likely to dry out.
REHYDRATE: Works to attract and hold onto moisture in the skin, leaving the skin softer.
A daily dose of this toner leaves your skin plump and soft to the touch.

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #407,558 in Beauty & Personal Care (See Top 100 in Beauty & Personal Care) #2,130 in Facial Toners & Astringents

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I don't know who needs to hear this, but all toners from now on need to be bubble toners. I will no longer tolerate a liquid mess of a toner. This bubble toner is amazing! I pump once or twice into my fingers, pat on my face, and am done! No pads or cotton balls needed or wasted again! No toner running down my wrists or neck wasted!This is a toner, so I wasn't expecting it to be super hydrating. That's not the point of a toner. But as a woman with dry skin, I was hoping it wouldn't make my skin worse. It's perfect for dry skin! No flakes or redness anywhere! Skin barrier perfectly preserved!Absolutely love this!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Watery. I like some of the ingredients. Made in China
reviews.reviewText: The box had a sticker on each side, sealing it. It's very important to me to have cosmetics that are sealed and unopened shipped, so that was nice to see. The bottle is plastic.It doesn't say on the site where it is made, but it is Made in China and distributed in USA. I think this should be up front on the site.Expiration date is 09/26.It has a light scent, which may be attributed to the prickly pear. It's foamy when pumped. A little goes a long way, because it's quite watery in texture and in feel. It seems to make a barrier on my skin, but my skin does not feel any softer from it. It wasn't irritating.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I had no idea what to expect from this product. Is it a toner? It is a face wash?The pump is what one would expect from a foaming soap product. But it’s not a soap like you would think. This is a product that foams and you just rub in and leave on. No rinsing off. The foaming action helps to spread it evenly without wasting any of the product. And no need for cotton pads to apply it with or waste product. Genius. It soaks into your skin quite nicely with no sticky residue leaving a gently moisturized feeling behind. The label says to test for irritation, but I haven’t experienced any issues. The scent is very light, but I wouldn’t call it scent-free. Overall, I like this product and I’m glad I decided to give it a try. Definitely recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Soothing, But No Added Hydration
reviews.reviewText: I have been using this product twice a day, in the morning and at night, to provide additional hydration to my very dry skin. However, I have not noticed any significant improvement in my skin's hydration level despite using 2 pumps each time. Although it does have a soothing effect, that's about it. Moreover, I have doubts about this California-based company's claim of being cruelty-free because they sent this product to be made in China where animal testing is mandatory.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Different kind of toner
reviews.reviewText: I have never used this kind of toner before- it kind of bubbles on your face and then evaporates. No need to use a pad/cloth with it. Nothing negative really to note, just hard to say if it is doing anything, any real "toning".

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is a fun product to use as it foams up, but I still like to use a cotton pad with it to ensure that I can cleanse off of my skin and prep it with the toner, which is what I normally do with a micellar water as the first step of my skincare routine. It's soothing and lightly hydrating, and is a great travel size container.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I've never had a bubble toner before, and this is really cool! You just pump it out and it comes out light and fluffy, like foam. Rub it on the skin and leave it. It has a cooling effect, and you don't need to rinse it off. I'm following with my regular serum and moisturizer, haven't experienced any irritation or breakouts. It seems to be helping my skin stay clear and smooth. I like it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I have a go-to department store toner that I love, but I thought I would give this a try. What I like about it is that you don't have to use a cotton pad to apply. That is amazing! This product also does feel really good on my skin and I have been able to tell a difference all day. I have super dry skin and use a good quality moisturizer. This is a great base under that.
